title: U.S. airports - public and private 1990 to 2018
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Public use, and Private use. The y axis represents Number of airports and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Private use is gradually decreasing, Public use is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Private use, and lastly, 2. Public use.
Throughout the period, Private use generally had the highest Number of airports relative to others with an average of 14126.75, and it reached its maximum at 7 with a value of 14839.0.
The botommost line, Public use,  has a mean of 5236.2, and peaked at 90.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Public use, and Private use. The y axis indicates the Number of airports and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Private use is gradually decreasing, Public use is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Number of airports in descending order is: 1. Private use, and lastly, 2. Public use.
